paper_metadata.title: MAIN TEXT
paper_metadata.extraction_summary: Extracted genetic variant information for the TTR gene, including penetrance data.

patients.demographics: Various populations, with specific mention of Portuguese, Swedish, and Afro-American individuals.
patients.phenotype: Hereditary transthyretin amyloidosis (ATTRv), primarily associated with polyneuropathy.

individual_records.phenotype_details: Early-onset ATTRv-PN with progressive axonal length-dependent sensorimotor polyneuropathy.
individual_records.evidence_sentence: While penetrance can be difficult to ascertain for late-onset variants, early-onset phenotypes (Val30Met) have a penetrance of 80% at 50 years and 91% at 70 years in Portuguese.
Late-onset ATTRv-PN phenotype begins at >50 years of age and occurs in endemic and non-endemic regions.
The carrier frequency in the Swedish population is high (~1.5%), with evidence of anticipation (~11.7 years).

functional_data.summary: The Val30Met mutation destabilizes the TTR tetramer, leading to amyloid fibril formation.

variants.segregation_data: Segregates with disease in families, particularly in Portuguese families.
variants.population_frequency: Carrier frequency in the Swedish population is ~1.5%.
variants.evidence_level: High, based on multiple studies and population data.
variants.additional_notes: The Val30Met variant is the most frequent mutation associated with ATTRv.
key_quotes: The Val30Met mutation is responsible for high prevalence of ATTRv in endemic areas, including Portugal.
While penetrance can be difficult to ascertain for late-onset variants, early-onset phenotypes (Val30Met) have a penetrance of 80% at 50 years and 91% at 70 years in Portuguese.

individual_records.phenotype_details: Late-onset ATTRv-CM with restrictive cardiac failure.
individual_records.evidence_sentence: ATTRv-CM is evident in ~50% of patients, and while frequently associated with Val122Ile.
ATTRv-CM is more common in late-onset (Val30Met) ATTRv.
The carrier frequency of the Val122Ile variant is higher in Afro-American populations.

functional_data.summary: The Val122Ile mutation is associated with late-onset cardiac dysfunction.

variants.segregation_data: Segregates with disease in families, particularly in African-American families.
variants.population_frequency: Higher prevalence in Afro-American populations (~3% to 4%).
variants.evidence_level: Moderate, based on familial segregation and population studies.
variants.additional_notes: The Val122Ile variant is associated with late-onset disease with predominant cardiac dysfunction.
key_quotes: ATTRv-CM is evident in ~50% of patients, and while frequently associated with Val122Ile.
The Val122Ile variant presents with late-onset disease with predominant cardiac dysfunction.

extraction_metadata.notes: All relevant data extracted from the main text.
